Posts.Content: I too believe HRT caused mine.  No family history, no other risk factors but had been on Premarin for years.  Mine was estrogen sensitive.
Posts.Title: What do you think may have caused your breast cancer?

Posts.Content: On 4/27/2007 Valerie1979 wrote: Hi everyone. I am really nervous right now, can anyone please help me? Thanks. I am a 27 years old female. I just finished my period today and I found a lump yesterday in my right breast (about 2 inches from my armpit towards the center of my body). It feels tender when I press on it and the tenderness last for a few minutes. I asked my father, who is a pediatrician, to examine it for me and he said it's moving and it's doesn't feel like cancer. However, this evening when I re-examined it, I found that the area between the lump and my armpit is slightly hardened and thicker than the the same area in my left breast. It's also a bit tender when I press it. I just don't know what that is...Could anyone please help me? Thanks again. It is not unusual to have "lumpy bumpy" breasts during and after a period.  Hormonal changes can create tenderness.  Wait 10-14 days and recheck the area.  If it is still there, see your personal physician.
Posts.Title: Lump Found In Right Breast...please help

Posts.Content: Am a breast cancer survivor currently taking Femara instead of Tamoxifen.  Would be interested in hearing from anyone who is also on Femara and the side effects encountered.  I am having trouble with arthritis and fatigue.  Have been on it 5 months. Diana
Posts.Title: Femara Side Effects

Posts.Content: I am on heart medication but have been on it long enough to know that it is not causing the problem.  I ache in the "bones" as well as joints.  It is not like pulled muscles, it is deeper.  Hands are affected right now--joints painful, diffult to use fingers, and fingers are swollen.  Nice to hear from someone who has completed Femara.  I am hoping the symptoms will ease the longer I stay on it.  Thanks for responding.
Posts.Title: Femara Side Effects
